data.title: Great Downtown Lunch Place (near Texas Cattle-Lake Mirror area)
data.text: This little place is gaining popularity. Great breakfast and lunch food. Try it once and you'll be back.Cooked to order Burgers, various Wrap creations,huge Salads, Philly Cheesesteak & exceptional Fish Tacos. The not so well kept secret is the best homemade soups in Lakeland. Jalepeno Creamy Potato, Beef n Cabbage, Sausage n Kale. Whatever the soups of the day are-try one. Lunchtime is busy. Call ahead and order. They have a drive- thru pick up window as well. They have delivery.

data.title: A Hidden Gem for Lunch
data.text: Super lunch spot.  The wife and I shared a 10 inch Philly Cheesesteak and a huge order of perfectly cooked waffle fries.  The roll reminded me of Amorosa's in Philly.  The steak was lean and no "chewies" like so many places.  Onions were done just right and lots of melted provalone.  We had them hold the peppers.  With 2 iced teas, the tab was $15.60 plus a $3 tip.  Wanted to try the fresh cherry cobbler with almond whipped cream, but no room.  Inside sesting is limited.  Tables outside for cooler weather.  We will definitely return for breakfast or lunch.  Glad it was recommended to us.

data.title: Delivery for delicious breakfast
data.text: We ordered and had breakfast delivered.  Was so good!!  I had the biscuits and gravy.  Caution, the biscuits are HUGE!  This is a very large portion that would be better shared.  Other got breakfast sandwiches and French toast.  All of it was delicious and we will definitely be ordering this again.  They also have a lunch menu.  There is something for everyone there.

data.title: 3 Ed time there and food was good
data.text: This is a small place downtown and we have eaten breakfast and lunch here they were both excellent the owner waits on you and serves you the food comes out hot and good

data.title: OK for breakfast but overpriced.
data.text: It's a crowded, narrow little place with average food that costs too much.  The wait staff aren't very friendly.  There are better places in town for breakfast or lunch.

data.title: Horrible customer service
data.text: With an owner who treats his customers like he did me, I will never return to this place again, Mike was a complete jerk 👎👎

data.title: quiet and great breakfast / near Mirror Lake
data.text: Visiting a doctor friend and she took me and my husband to the Main Street Diner after our morning walk from her home to downtown Lakeland on March 15, 2014.  I've been here once before back in October 2013 with her also so I feel compelled to write a review.  I had their breakfast wrap again (eggs, sausage, green pepper, onion, salsa, cheese) and it is so yummy and hit the spot.  My doctor friend ALWAYS has a burger, but because she was trying to not have so many calories, she tried a spinach, egg, feta, wrap which she said was great.  But don't be scared to have one of their burgers for breakfast because she raves about them.  My husband had a combo wrap (sausage, bacon, eggs, onion, cheese) and loved that.  The counter guy (one of 2 owners)  told my friend that he was going to make a mac&cheese burger for the upcoming week for St Patricks Day.  Now doesn't that sound interesting????

data.title: Great place to see a baseball game
data.text: Lakes are filled with wild water fowl The town has adopted Swans Check out the many huge painted statues of Swans Being a northern water fowl guy it was breathe taking

data.title: Il vero hamburger americano !!!!!
data.text:
Un piccolo chiosco nel cuore di Lakeland  ....
Propone hamburger eccezionali con prodotti freschissimi e conditi con ingredienti sfiziosi 
Ideale l'asporto per poterli gustare nel parco con laghetto , distante soltanto pochi passi !!!!
